game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Game is the controlling class for the ShippingGame Project. It manages the go-between between the board, which maintains the state of the game, and the gui, which visually displays it. Finally, the class maintains the managers, i.e. the user-written classes that fill in the truck's missing behavior
    Author:
    MPatashnik

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game(java.lang.String managerClassname, java.io.File f)
      Constructor: a game instance with a set Board that is read from File f, using the manager whose class name is managerClassname.
      Game(java.lang.String managerClassname, java.io.File f, int frame)
      Constructor: a game instance with a set Board that is read from File f, using the manager whose class name is managerClassname, and uses the given frame rate
      Game(java.lang.String managerClassname, long seed)
      Constructor: a game instance with a random board from seed seed using the manager whose class name is managerClassname.
      Game(java.lang.String managerClassname, long seed, int frame)
      Constructor: a game instance with a random board from seed seed using the manager whose class name is managerClassname, and uses the given frame rate.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_FRAME

        public static final int DEFAULT_FRAME
        The default frame value. Other frame values can be used for testing, but only games run with this frame value are fair for scoring.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • setManager

        public boolean setManager(java.lang.String managerClassname)
        If the manager and managerClass are null, set the manager to the class whose name is managerClassname. Also set the game of the constructed manager to this. Return true iff the manager is set this way.

      • getFrame

        public int getFrame()
        Return the duration of a frame for this game, in milliseconds

      • setFrame

        public void setFrame(int f)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the duration of a frame for this game, in milliseconds. If this value of f is new and the game is currently running, trips the frameAltered flag. A lower value means a faster game -- more penalty for computation. A higher value means a slower game -- less penalty for computation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if f <= 0

      • isFrameAltered

        public boolean isFrameAltered()
        Return true iff the frame rate of this game was altered in such a way that changed the running of the game

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Return true iff this game is currently running (in progress, not completed).

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Return true iff this game is finished.

      • getBoard

        public Board getBoard()
        Return the board of this game.
        See Also:
        for what information is contained therein.

      • getManager

        public Manager getManager()
        Return the manager for this Game.

      • getManagerClassname

        public java.lang.String getManagerClassname()
        Return a String of the class name used to load the manager.

      • getFile

        public java.io.File getFile()
        Return the file from which this game was created (null if created randomly and thus not loaded).

      • getSeed

        public long getSeed()
        Return the seed from which this game was generated from (-1 if this game was loaded from a non-randomly generated file.)

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the game by the manager run; then have each truck begin running. Additional calls to this method after the first call do nothing.

      • getThrownThrowable

        public java.lang.Throwable getThrownThrowable()
        Return the exception thrown during the running of this game. (null if that hasn't happened).

      • getGUI

        public GUI getGUI()
        Return the GUI that represents this game.

      • setGUI

        public void setGUI(GUI g)
        Set the GUI that draws this game to g. Students: don't call this

      • getUpdateMessage

        public java.lang.String getUpdateMessage()
        Return the current update message shown on the GUI.

      • setUpdateMessage

        public void setUpdateMessage(java.lang.String s)
        Update the GUI to show s as an update message for a few seconds.

      • parcelStats

        public int[] parcelStats()
        Return the parcel stats for the current game in the form [on city, on truck, delivered]

      • truckStats

        public int[] truckStats()
        Return the truck stats for the current game in the form [waiting, traveling, getting manager input]

      • kill

        public void kill()
        End this game prematurely by halting trucks and manager. This will interrupt the manager and truck threads.

      • gameFile

        public static java.io.File gameFile(java.lang.String filename)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Return a file for the string board filename. Throw an IllegalArgumentException if this board does not exist.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • writeGame

        public void writeGame(java.lang.String fileName)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.lang.RuntimeException
        Write this Game to a text file that can be loaded and re-played later. Can be used only if the game has not yet started or finished. If either of these is true, throw a runtime exception.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - If the file writing goes bad.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the game is not in its pre-start state.
